label: MTOR-related overgrowth spectrum
definition: Any overgrowth syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a pathogenic gain-of-function variants in the MTOR gene. The variants can be germline or somatic.

label: neurodevelopmental disorder with hypotonia, feeding difficulties, facial dysmorphism, and brain abnormalities
developmental delay-language impairment-dopa responsive dystonia-parkinsonism syndrome due to a NR4A2 point mutation
definition: An intellectual developmental disorder with language impairment and early-onset DOPA-responsive dystonia-parkinsonism in which the cause of the disease is a point mutation in the gene NR4A2.

label: autosomal dominant dopa-responsive dystonia
definition: A rare neurometabolic disorder characterized by childhood-onset dystonia that shows a dramatic and sustained response to low doses of levodopa (L-dopa) and that may be associated with parkinsonism at an older age.

label: neuronopathy, distal hereditary motor, autosomal recessive 11, with spasticity
neurodevelopmental disorder with hypotonia, brain anomalies, distinctive facies, and absent language
anhidrotic ectodermal dysplasia EDAR-related, cattle
definition: An inherited syndrome characterized by hypotrichosis (sparseness of hair), hypo- or an-hidrosis (reduced ability to sweat), and hypodontia (congenital absence of teeth) in cattle due to a variation in the EDAR gene.

label: copper toxicosis, COMMD1-related, dog
definition: Excess accumulation of copper in the liver with a centrilobular distribution in dogs due to a variation in the COMMD1 gene.

label: congenital myasthenic syndrome, COLQ-related, dog
definition: An early onset syndrome of impaired neuromuscular transmission associated with an acetylcholinesterase deficiency in dogs due to a variation in the COLQ gene.

label: congenital myasthenic syndrome, CHAT-related, dog
definition: An early onset syndrome of impaired neuromuscular transmission associated with a defect in acetylcholine synthesis in dogs due to a variation in the CHAT gene.

label: amelogenesis imperfecta, ENAM-related, dog
definition: An inherited disorder affecting the structure, composition, and quantity of tooth enamel in dogs due to a variation in the ENAM gene.

label: amelogenesis imperfecta, ACP4-related, dog
definition: An inherited disorder affecting the structure, composition, and quantity of tooth enamel in dogs due to a variation in the ACP4 gene.

label: congenital stationary night blindness, TRPM1-related, horse
definition: Non-progressive vision impairment in dim or absent lighting in horses due to a variation in the TRPM1 gene. Specifically, horses homozygous for a white spotting phenotype, known as leopard complex spotting, are affected by CSNB.

label: congenital stationary night blindness, LRIT3-related, dog
definition: Non-progressive vision impairment in dim or absent lighting in dogs due to a variation in the LRIT3 gene.

hyperornithinemia, hyperammonemia, and homocitrullinuria syndrome, horse
myopathy of the diaphragmatic muscles, cattle

progressive ataxia with head tremor and seizures, dog
follicular dysplasia and interface dermatitis, dog
retinal dysplasia and persistent primary vitreous, dog
juvenile with age-dependent emphysema hypotrichosis, pig
unilateral subcortical heterotopia, California sea lion
rupture of the cranial cruciate ligament, dog
dilute coat color with neurological defects, dog
dilute coat color with neurological defects, horse
colorectal hamartomatous polyposis and ganglioneuromatosis, dog
combined deficiency of factors IX and XII, domestic cat
persistent right aortic arch with subclavian artery and ligamentum arteriosum, dog
brachygnathia, cardiomegaly and renal hypoplasia syndrome, sheep
neuroaxonal dystrophy with cerebellar abiotrophy, domestic cat
vitamin D-deficiency rickets, non-type I, non-type II, domestic cat
congenital merosin-deficient muscular dystrophy, domestic cat
complement component 4 deficiency, domestic guinea pig
retinal dysplasia and internal hydrocephalus, cattle
congenital keratoconjunctivitis sicca and ichthyosiform dermatosis, dog
proportionate dwarfism with inflammatory lesions, cattle
congenital hydranencephaly and cerebellar hypoplasia, water buffalo
congenital hydranencephaly and cerebellar hypoplasia, cattle
gyrate atrophy of choroid and retina, domestic cat
squamous cell carcinoma of the digit, dog
intestinal cobalamin (vitamin B12) malabsorption, domestic cat
congenital myopathy with fiber-type disproportion, dog
retinal degeneration, Smoky Joe, chicken
definition: Retinal degeneration that occurs in the Smoky Joe breed of chicken.

label: cervical vertebral compressive myelopathy, mountain zebra
skeletal dysplasia with craniofacial deformity and disproportionate dwarfism, sheep
hypotrichosis with short life expectancy, domestic cat
combined deficiency of factors VIII, IX, and X, horse
autosomal T cell-negative, B cell-negative, NK cell-positive severe combined immunodeficiency disease with sensitivity to ionizing radiation, pig
generalized myoclonic epilepsy with photosensitivity, dog
verrucous epidermal keratinocytic nevi, domestic cat
bilateral deafness and vestibular dysfunction, dog
bilateral deafness and vestibular dysfunction, pig

diffuse cystic renal dysplasia and hepatic fibrosis, dog
Meckel-like hepatorenal fibrocystic dysplasia syndrome, sheep

neuropathy and feather color dilution, Northern goshawk

growth and respiratory lethal syndrome, cattle

cancer, dog

label: cancer, domestic cat
definition: Cancer that occurs in domestic cats.

label: cancer, pig
definition: Cancer that occurs in pigs.

label: Mollaretâ€™s meningitis
definition: A rare clinical disorder characterized by at least three recurrent episodes of meningitis associated with spontaneous recovery with or without antiviral therapy. Herpes simplex virus type 2 has frequently been implicated in the setting of this illness. RBLM is rare with prevalence rates estimated at 2 per 100,000 persons.

label: PIK3CA-related overgrowth spectrum
definition: Any overgrowth syndrome resulting from pathogenic gain-of-function variants in the PIK3CA gene. The variants can be germline or somatic

label: PIK3R2-related overgrowth spectrum
definition: Any overgrowth syndrome resulting from pathogenic gain-of-function variants in the PIK3R2 gene. The variants can be germline or somatic

label: TRIP11-related skeletal dysplasia
definition: Any skeletal dysplasia in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the TRIP11 gene. Reduced protein function in TRIP11 causes a spectrum of skeletal symptoms from a more mild phenotype, called ondontochondrodysplasia, with features including short stature and joint laxity to a more severe phenotype, called achondrogenesis type 1A, which presents as a lethal prenatal or neonatal skeletal dysplasia. The clinical severity of achondrogenesis compared to ondontochondrodysplasia is related to the residual function of the gene which is not currently possible to anticipate based on genotype alone. The phenotype cannot fully be predicted by genotype alone, evidenced by variants being reported with both phenotypes.

label: IRF6-related condition
definition: Van der Woude syndrome, popliteal pterygium syndrome, cleft lip with or without palate, or a spectrum of one or two of those conditions in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the IRF6 gene.

label: vertebral artery dissection
definition: A human disorder which results from a tear in one of the major cervicocerebral arteries, allowing blood to enter the wall of the artery and split its layers. Pathogenesis typically leads to either stenosis or aneurysmal dilatation of the vessel.

label: PI4KA-related disorder
definition: Any human disease in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the PI4KA gene. This disease is characterized primarily by neurologic dysfunction (limb spasticity, developmental delay, intellectual disability, seizures, ataxia, nystagmus), gastrointestinal manifestations (multiple intestinal atresia, inflammatory bowel disease), and combined immunodeficiency (leukopenia, variable immunoglobulin defects). Age of onset is typically antenatal or in early childhood; individuals can present with any combination of these features. Rare individuals present with later-onset hereditary spastic paraplegia. Brain MRI findings can include hypomyelinating leukodystrophy, cerebellar hypoplasia/atrophy, thin or dysplastic corpus callosum, and/or perisylvian polymicrogyria.

label: infectious disease with sepsis
definition: An infectious disease characterized by life-threatening organ dysfunction due to a dysreguated host response.

label: cerebral artery stenosis
definition: A cerebrovascular disorder characterized by an abnormal narrowing of a cerebral artery.

label: intestinal fistula
definition: An intestinal disorder characterized by an opening in the intestine to some epithelial surface.

label: Enterococcus infectious disease
definition: A bacterial disease caused by infection with Enterococcus.

label: methicillin-susceptible staphylococcus aureus infectious disease
definition: A bacterial infectious disease caused by methicillin-susceptible staphylococcus aureus.

label: congenital myasthenic syndrome 4
definition: Any postsynaptic congenital myasthenic syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CHRNE gene.

label: myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody-associated disease
definition: A demyelinating disease of the central nervous system characterized by the presence of a demyelinating event (optic neuritis, myelitis, acute/multiphasic encephalomyelitis, cerebral or polyfocal deficits, brainstem or cerebellar deficits, and/or cerebral cortical encephalitis), a positive myelin oligodendrocyte glycorotein-IgG test, and exclusion of an alternative diagnosis like MS.

label: metastatic malignant neoplasm in the brain
definition: A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site.

label: hypermobility spectrum disorder
definition: An array of connective tissue disorders characterized by joint instability and chronic pain. Fatigue and other systemic symptoms that affect daily function may occur as well. These diseases are scored using the Beighton scoring system and one of more secondary musculoskeletal manifestations including post-traumatic symptoms, pain, altered proprioception, and a variety of other characteristics like pes planus, kyphosis, scoliosis, or joint misalignment.

label: Sharpin-related autoinflammatory syndrome
definition: An autoinflammatory disease in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the Sharpin gene.

label: GBA1-related Parkinson disease, susceptibility
definition: A susceptibility or predisposition to Parkinsons disease in which the cause of the disease is the presence of a monoallelic pathogenic variant or risk allele in the GBA1 gene.

label: dyneinopathy
definition: A spectrum of diseases related to monoallelic variants in DYNC1H1 and characterized by variable neuromuscular and/or neurodevelopmental presentations. While not absolute, there appear to be genotype-phenotype correlations based on the location of the variant. Patients with variants in the stem domain of DYNC1H1 have been reported with a predominantly neuromuscular presentation, including congenital myopathy, spinal muscular atrophy, Charcot-Marie-Tooth (CMT), and less frequently, intellectual disability and autism. Patients with variants in the motor domain predominantly present with neurodevelopmental presentations including intellectual disability, seizures, malformations of cortical development (abnormal brain MRI findings such as pachygyria, heterotopias, enlarged ventricles, hypoplasia of CC, brain stem, cerebellum), autism, and less frequently, neuromuscular phenotypes.

label: EN1-related dorsoventral syndrome
definition: A human mesomelic and rhizo-mesomelic dysplasia characterized by marked mesomelic shortening of the lower limbs, cutaneous syndactyly and nail abnormalities (placed on the palmar side of the finger, dysplastic or absent) in hands and feet due mutations in EN1 gene. Other clinical features may include genitourinary abnormalities (including bilateral cryptorchidism, vesicoureteral reflux, hydronephrosis, hypoplastic labia majora), spasticity and seizures.

label: congenital muscular dystrophy without intellectual disability
definition: A congenital muscular dystrophy due to dystroglycanopathy characterized by a wide phenotypic spectrum which includes hypotonia and muscular weakness present at birth or early infancy, delayed or arrested motor development, and normal intellectual abilities with normal (or only mild abnormalities) neuroimaging studies. Feeding difficulties, joint and spinal deformities, and respiratory insufficiency may be associated. Decreased alpha-dystroglycan on immunohistochemical muscle staining and elevated serum creatine kinase are observed.
